page.title: 17ST.JOHN'S SCHOOL,CALDER VALE
page.content: St.John's C.E.School was built in 1862 next to the church at the top of Church Wood. It cannot be reached directly from the village by car and many of the children walk to school along a steep path through the woods, which are particularly attractive in Spring when the bluebells are in bloom. Between 30-40 children aged between 5 and 11 attend the school. The majority of them live in the village but there are many who come from outlying farms up to 3.5 miles away. There are three rooms, one of which is used as a hall, and also a kitchen, although the dinners are now sent from a larger school in Garstang. We think it is a very busy and active little school. For example we go out on many visits in connection with our school project work.
